name: MHOSiLa
short_description:
MHOSiLa aims to be a retargetable, Multi Hosted (Simple) Operating System for computers based on 6502, Z80 and (perhaps) other 8 bit processors with soft interrupt capabilities.

Mainly targeted for the TK-2000 Color Computer (an expanded brazilian clone from the Multitech's Micro Professor II), it provides device independency for mass storage, remote communications, a simple file handling and memory management.

An Apple II+ port will be always guaranteed, an ProDOS hosted version for the Apple //e is in the Road Map.

Binary compatibility is (somewhat, due differences between the host machines) guaranteed for 6502 code using a "Level 0" API programs from previous OS version targeted programs.

Interface stability is guaranteed for previous versions (older programs will compile/assemble on newer versions, and vice versa if only older functionalities are used).

Architecture inspired by Acorn's MOS.
summary: A Mostly Harmless Operating System for 65xx and others 8 bit computers
